properties.displayName: Your execution will pause until a webhook is called. This URL will be generated at runtime and passed to your Github workflow as a resumeUrl input.
properties.name: webhookNotice
workflowId
properties.description: The workflow to dispatch

properties.name: ref
properties.description: The git reference for the workflow dispatch (branch or tag name)

properties.name: inputs
properties.description: JSON object with input parameters for the workflow

properties.name: filePath
properties.description: The file path of the file. Has to contain the full path.

properties.name: filePath
properties.description: The path of the folder to list

properties.name: binaryData
properties.description: Whether the data to upload should be taken from binary field

properties.name: fileContent
properties.description: The text content of the file

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the input binary field containing the file to be written

properties.name: additionalParameters
properties.description: Additional fields to add

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the author of the commit

values.name: email
values.description: The email of the author of the commit

values.name: branch
values.description: The branch to commit to. If not set the repository’s default branch (usually master) is used.

values.name: name
values.description: The name of the committer of the commit

values.name: email
values.description: The email of the committer of the commit

properties.name: asBinaryProperty
properties.description: Whether to set the data of the file as binary property instead of returning the raw API response

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in

properties.name: additionalParameters
properties.description: Additional fields to add

options.name: reference
options.description: The name of the commit/branch/tag. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually master).

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the issue

properties.name: body
properties.description: The body of the issue

properties.name: labels
properties.description: Label to add to issue

properties.name: assignees
properties.description: User to assign issue too

properties.name: issueNumber
properties.description: The number of the issue on which to create the comment on

properties.name: body
properties.description: The body of the comment

properties.name: issueNumber
properties.description: The number of the issue edit

properties.name: editFields
properties.description: User to assign issue to

properties.name: issueNumber
properties.description: The issue number to get data for

properties.name: issueNumber
properties.description: The issue number to lock

properties.name: lockReason
properties.description: The issue is Off-Topic

properties.name: releaseTag
properties.description: The tag of the release

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The name of the issue

options.name: draft
options.description: Whether to create a draft (unpublished) release, "false" to create a published one

options.name: prerelease
options.description: Whether to point out that the release is non-production ready

options.name: target_commitish
options.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch(usually master).

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The body of the release

options.name: draft
options.description: Whether to create a draft (unpublished) release, "false" to create a published one

options.name: prerelease
options.description: Whether to point out that the release is non-production ready

options.name: target_commitish
options.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch(usually master).

properties.name: getRepositoryIssuesFilters
properties.description: Return only issues which are assigned to a specific user

options.name: assignee
options.description: Return only issues which are assigned to a specific user

options.name: creator
options.description: Return only issues which were created by a specific user

options.name: mentioned
options.description: Return only issues in which a specific user was mentioned

options.name: labels
options.description: Return only issues with the given labels. Multiple labels can be separated by comma.

options.name: since
options.description: Return only issues updated at or after this time

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return. Maximum value is 100.

properties.description: The SHA of the commit that needs a review, if different from the latest

notices.name: webhookNotice
notices.text: Your execution will pause until a webhook is called. This URL will be generated at runtime and passed to your Github workflow as a resumeUrl input.

hints.text: The name of the input binary field containing the file to be written
The name of the output binary field to put the file in

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
